title: 4 Steps to Disconnect Hearing Aid Devices From an iPhone

steps.title: Open your iPhone's Settings.
steps.content: Open your iPhone's Settings. You can find this app on your home screen or in the App Library. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Accessibility.
steps.content: Tap Accessibility . This is usually in the section with General .

steps.title: Tap Hearing Devices.
steps.content: Tap Hearing Devices . This is underneath the Hearing header.

steps.title: Toggle off "Bluetooth".
steps.content: Toggle off "Bluetooth". Bluetooth must be enabled to connect hearing aids and sound processors made for iPhones. By turning this off, hearing devices will be disabled. If needed, you can also toggle off Hearing Aid Compatibility (previously Hearing Aid Mode), which can improve the audio quality with some hearing devices. If you use your AirPods as hearing aids , you can turn it off by disconnecting them .
